name: L'ile Oubliée
overview:
Looking for your missing brother at sea, your own ship is wrecked during a violent storm. You wake up on a beach and quickly discover that you have failed on a desert island. Your goal now is to explore the island in search of a way to escape.

Adventure game parser developed late at the bedside of a CPC in the twilight of his life, L'ile Oubliée wants to pay tribute to the games created by the company Lankhor whose developer seems passionate since it goes to retake maliciously the design of the credits page. And the disciple is not far from equal the master because if we ignore some minor inconsistencies, a lack of shortcuts sometimes annoying but especially a misspelling, the scenario mature and well-crafted as well as sumptuous and varied graphics quickly plunge the player into an adventure full of exoticism which knew so well we water the publisher pen. It does not lack much to be tempered by a commercial production and we can not recommend too much this nugget unfortunately remained unknown.
